acknowledge.translation[0].definitions[0: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists
The family acknowledge the need for change.
Claire acknowledged that she was guilty.
The government must acknowledge what is happening and do something about it.
This is a fact that most smokers readily acknowledge.
He acknowledges that when he’s tired he gets bad-tempered.
In more formal English, you say it is acknowledged that when saying what people generally agree is true
It is acknowledged that these letters are genuine
acknowledge.translation[0].definitions[1: if people acknowledge something, they recognize how good or important it is
The Brazilian coach acknowledged the talent of his players.
The mill produces what is widely acknowledged to be the finest wool in the world.
be widely/generally acknowledged to be something
The film festival is acknowledged as an event of international importance.
acknowledge.translation[0].definitions[2: to accept that someone or something has authority over people
Both defendants refused to acknowledge the authority of the court.
Many of the poor acknowledged him as their spiritual leader.
acknowledge.translation[0].definitions[3: to publicly announce that you are grateful for the help that someone has given you
We wish to acknowledge the support of the university.
acknowledge.translation[0].definitions[4: to show someone that you have noticed them or heard what they have said
Tom acknowledged her presence by a brief glance.
acknowledge.translation[0].definitions[5: to let someone know that you have received something from them
I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
acknowledge.translation[1].definitions[0: to tell someone that you have received something such as a letter they have sent to you
We shall be grateful if you will kindly acknowledge receipt of this letter.
acknowledge.translation[1].definitions[1: to admit or accept that something is true or exists
The government acknowledged that there had been irregularities at a number of voting centres.
